definition: a snap of the fingers (idiom); in an instant/in a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: Today the business environment is more petitive and fast-changing than ever.
sentences.chinese: 現今的商業環境，競爭愈發劇烈，變革彈指之間。

sentences.english: And your music is right at your fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 你的音樂就在彈指之間。

sentences.english: The flight of time, in a short moment, everything into the distant past.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，彈指之間，一切都化爲遙遠的往昔。

sentences.english: I face difficulties at your fingertips when you retrieve it necessary to calm.
sentences.chinese: 在彈指之間找回我面對困境時那必要的冷靜。

sentences.english: Can be their own need to steal cards in the in a short moment.
sentences.chinese: 可以將自己所需要的牌在彈指之間偷過來。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
equestrianism/horsemanship
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
Iron Curtain (1945-1991) (in Taiwan, 鐵幕 was used to refer to both the Iron Curtain and the Bamboo Curtain)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
greed/avarice/rapacious/avid
video program
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
